summary: The @temporalio/core-bridge package cannot be built from source in Alpine Linux because bridge-macros files were refactored into a separate top-level folder but were not included in the package.json files list after version 0.12.0.
userImpact: Users building in Alpine/musl environments cannot build the core-bridge Rust binary from source, blocking deployment in containerized environments.
rootCause: After refactoring bridge-macros into a separate top-level folder, the files were not included in the package.json files field, making them unavailable in the installed npm package.
proposedFix: Include bridge-macros files in the core-bridge package.json files field alongside other Rust source files, and optionally add musl target support with strip flag in Cargo.toml.
workaround: Commit the bridge-macros files directly to the repository and apply custom patches for musl support in the build pipeline.
resolutionDetails: PR #1852 was opened to address the missing bridge-macros files in the package distribution.
keyQuote: These files should be included in the `core-bridge` package along with the other rust source files so that we can build them from source.
